text: William Daniel Phillips (born November 5, 1948) is an American physicist. He shared the Nobel Prize in Physics, in 1997, with Steven Chu and Claude Cohen- Tannoudji. In 1996, he received the Albert A. Michelson Medal from The Franklin Institute. Phillips is also a professor of physics, which is part of the University of Maryland College of Computer, Mathematical, and Natural Sciences at University of Maryland, College Park. ==References== Category:1948 births Category:Living people Category:American physicists Category:Academics from Maryland Category:Scientists from Pennsylvania Category:People from Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania
title: William Daniel Phillips
